Pre-Game Insights: England has a great record at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, having won five of the seven games played.
The Antigua pitch will have a good pace and bounce initially, which might help the team batting first.
As the match progresses, expect the spinners to come into the game more, with the average second-innings score here being less.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The last time ODI cricket was played at this venue was in December last year, where England kept the series alive with a win by six wickets.
Sam Curran took 3/33 in the West Indies' innings, leading to a disastrous start for the hosts.
Shai Hope and Sherfane Rutherford made fifties, while England spinners kept West Indies at bay.
